tags: she read the emotional state of the mole and knew he was still off-edge because of his near-death and she knew this was all it would take
summary: Another cool moment in this show is the safe house scenes, where the muscle-y guys are like “You want me to drag him in by the...
body:
Another cool moment in this show is the safe house scenes, where the muscle-y guys are like “You want me to drag him in by the armpits?” But then Carolyn is like, ‘No. I know exactly what he needs. I’m so sorry you have to see this.’

and this is how she interrogates/gets the intel from him:

the tough guy act wouldn’t have worked, but Carolyn pretending to be more maternal and caring than she actually is to trick this guy DID

another cool way of wielding ‘femininity’ as a weapon

summary: There’s like a million theories about how Eve and Villanelle will meet for the first time in Season 2, but what if how it...
body:
There’s like a million theories about how Eve and Villanelle will meet for the first time in Season 2, but what if how it happens has been right in front of us this whole time?

What if the writers really decided to honour Jennings and will do that thing that Villanelle did in Book 1 which ended up haunting Eve all through Book 2?

What if…

…Villanelle and Eve meeting again is Villanelle literally creeping in to watch Eve sleep, contemplating what to do next?

tags: Eve would have ID-ed her eventually
lol I do not doubt Eve Polastri's abilties
but is a little funny that V's crush doomed her even on day 1
summary: If Eve hadn’t been Villanelle’s type, she would never have said anything to her in the bathroom, and Eve would have not went...
body:
If Eve hadn’t been Villanelle’s type, she would never have said anything to her in the bathroom, and Eve would have not went looking for ‘the nurse’ (because you don’t really think about a person who just went into the stall and left. You do remember the person who says a very random nice thing to you) which means she wouldn’t have been able to physically ID her 

So if Villanelle had just contained herself and said nothing like usual… season 1 might have gone down very differently.

title: The 17 TV Scene Stealers of 2018
excerpt: From Jodie Comer and Julia Garner to Penn Badgley and Richard Madden, ET gives props to those who gave their small-screen best in 2018.
description:
Betty Gilpin in GLOW

Betty Gilpin’s first career Emmy nomination, for portraying GLOW’s Debbie Eagan, may have sent her into “shock and denial paralysis” earlier this year, but it came as no surprise to anyone who’s watched her stellar turn as the Netflix comedy’s soap star-turned-star-spangled sparrer. While Debbie’s wrestling alter ego, Liberty Belle, is the picture of patriotic poise, the show’s second season saw her taking on a heel role outside the ring, sifting through the remains of her crumbled marriage and grasping for creative power as the show’s sole female producer. But while her character was sinking to rock bottom, Gilpin’s performance soared, bringing a heartfelt humanity to Debbie’s animated anguish and stealing scenes both dramatic and comedic. - Meredith B. Kile

Jodie Comer, Killing Eve

There would be no Killing Eve without Jodie Comer’s fierce, delicious portrayal of the psychopathic assassin Villanelle, who goes toe to toe with Sandra Oh’s MI5 agent Eve Polastri for much of the first season. Comer has been charming British audiences for a while now, but it’s the delightfully juicy BBC America cat-and-mouse drama that has made the 25-year-old actress a force to be reckoned with in America. She’s been snubbed at major awards shows (ahem, Golden Globes and SAG Awards), but it’s become abundantly clear that Comer’s peerless work on the small screen is just as significant as Oh’s. Consider Villanelle and Eve’s first real interaction in the fifth episode, where a simple meal between foes conveys the intricate layers of their engrossing relationship. - Philiana Ng

summary: What are you most hoping to see in Killing Eve season 2? Do think there's any chance of an actual romantic relationship between...
question: What are you most hoping to see in Killing Eve season 2? Do think there's any chance of an actual romantic relationship between Eve and Villanelle? (I started watching this show after your posts about it and I'm hooked now).
answer: Oh man there are soooo many things I wanna see in season 2! Well, I wanna see a deepening of the relationship between Eve and Villanelle, which Sandra has already said is gonna happen. I don’t know if we will see an actual romantic relationship in season 2 but I definitely think we will see the buildup to it. I also want more backstory on Villanelle and more insight into the Twelve. AND FUCKING CAROLYN WHAT THE HELL?!

reblog.comment: Oh man there are soooo many things I wanna see in season 2! I don’t know if we will see an actual romantic relationship in season 2 but I definitely think we will see the buildup to it. I also want more backstory on Villanelle and more insight into the Twelve. AND FUCKING CAROLYN WHAT THE HELL?!

summary: Do you think eve will tell nico about what’s been happening with her and villanelle or do you think it will be more of him...
question: Do you think eve will tell nico about what’s been happening with her and villanelle or do you think it will be more of him finding out on his own ?
answer:
Hello anon!

Now that we’ve got a peak at the first look of Killing Eve season 2, I think it’s safe to say that yes, Eve will tell Niko what happened, regarding the knife. However, I do not believe Eve will tell Niko about what’s hiding beneath the surface of her, regarding any feelings of any kind that she might have for Villanelle. Because, you know, when season 2 starts, Eve’s head has got to be pretty much like dis:
